page.title: 13TOG HILL FARM, COLD ASHTON.
page.content: The{farmhouse}at the top of Tog Hill, in the parish of Doynton, was built in 1690 as a resting place for monks, journeying from Glastonbury to Malmesbury.It was extended in 1860. It has been farmed by the present family for 60 years , though they did not buy it until 1977 from the Tracey Park Estate. Today the farm{employs}3 people. They farm mainly cattle, sheep, pigs, corn and potatoes and other things in small quantities to sell for{freezers. The customers are from Bath or passing trade and gradually increase each year.Bed and breakfast is available at Â£10 per night.Examples of{prices at present per lb. are pork 69p, lamb 89p,beef Â£1.18., chickens 69p and turkeys 89p. Eggs are 80p per dozen and potatoes Â£1.80 per 56lb. sack..
